intro: Prunus dulcis var. fragilis, commonly known as the Persian almond, is a variety of almond tree native to the Middle East and Central Asia. It is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and its edible, sweet-tasting nuts. The tree typically grows to a height of 5–10 meters and prefers well-drained soils. It is known for its cold hardiness and ability to thrive in arid climates. The fruit, which matures in late summer, is encased in a hard shell and requires careful harvesting due to its delicate nature.
